Looking at an article recently on CodePen inspired a bit of curiosity. I saw the color declaration "deepskyblue" and I thought man that's a nice blue.

Lo and behold, there are several other color names available. A bit of research revealed approximately 140!. I say approximately because who knows, the interwebs may be wrong and there may be more. But I found it on w3schools.

Pretty cool to say the least.

This inspired me to create a personal guide. I've needed an excuse to use flexbox… well here it is:

View Site

One last thing, if you take a look at the source code, you'll notice no SASS partials. This is because of a faulty clone on my part where I overrode my local repo with an empty remote folder. Nice.

As a result I lost all my work minus what was open in Firefox and Chrome. Thank God for the console. I restored what I had and decided I'd leave it as it. I'll remake the source files if needed in the near future.
